intro: Pimpinella neumannii, commonly known as the Neumann's cow-wheat, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its small white or greenish flowers bloom in early spring, and it produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps. The species is noted for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
